rev.comment: /* Origin of names */ minor style tweak
sundry POV? Look up a dictionary: it's an adjective meaning " various; miscellaneous" and I replaced various with it because the sentence sounds better due to general overuse of the word "various"
/* Origin of names */ sundry- POV change to various
/* Origin of names */ shortening ref. to hindustan- half a para on that is too much
/* Origin of names */ each name merits a brief one-sentence breakdown
/* Origin of names */ shorten, for balance of attention with the main words
/* Origin of names */ rewrite for clarity
It is Gandhi alone who is recognized as leading the non-violent movement; Nehru was about policy, diplomacy and political; he & others supported but did not 'lead' the peace movement)

/Demographics/ rm->(including [[Punjabi]], [[Urdu]]...)---makes no sense to have Punjabi 26 million speakers in list & Telgu 66 mil not in list. There is a link to Indian languages within this section
/* History */ Removed the last 3 lines on when India proved its nuclear weapons capability.
rv. edits by Anon to last version by [[User:Ambarish]]; number of official languages is dynamic, and also irrelevant
/* Origin of name */ There is no confusion as to the idea that Bharat came from one of the kings, one of who is a key dynastic figure in the Mahaabhaarat... all that's debated is which one.

correct order of agglomerations, alphabetise order of languages, etc.
=Indian Society= Sati is not ancient but came during Mughal rule; child marriage is not particularly 'hindu' but prevalent across Hindu and Muslim societies in India
=Science and Math= [[arabic numerals]] says that it's debatable whether indians created them entirely; links to famous scientists etc

the 844 dialects are no official languages
added section society- for caste and other matters.
NPOV: many muslims, sikhs and christians also indulge in caste prejudice and there are groups of hindus who have never done so and don't feel it is part of hinduism, but is a twist-up of hindu values
many feel caste is more societal perversion of Hinduism; muslims, christians, and sikhs in many areas rigidly adhere by caste i.e. kerala church; muslim trade castes, Sikh marriages, etc.
